intro: Urobotrya stapfiana, commonly known as the Stapf's urobotrya, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of East Africa, particularly Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is a shrub characterized by its small, opposite leaves and yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in rocky and well-drained soils, often found in dry, high-altitude habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
